title: How Many Calories Are in Salt?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in salt—spoiler: it's zero—plus sodium details, equivalents, and FAQs on this essential seasoning.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Salt?
assumptions: Table salt (sodium chloride), fine grain; 1 tsp ≈ 6 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (table, sea, kosher) and grain size; volume measures can differ in density. Calories are always zero.

quick_answer.text: Salt contains 0 calories per teaspoon or any amount.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Sea salt instead of table salt (per tsp)
Kosher salt (flakier, less dense per tsp)

faqs.q: How many calories in salt per teaspoon?
faqs.a: Zero calories in 1 tsp of salt.

faqs.q: Does salt have any nutritional value besides sodium?
faqs.a: Salt provides no calories, protein, fat, or carbs—only sodium for electrolyte balance.

faqs.q: Why do calories in salt matter for diets?
faqs.a: Salt has 0 calories, so it doesn't affect calorie intake, but watch sodium for blood pressure.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in salt?
faqs.a: About 2325 mg sodium per 1 tsp table salt, nearly the daily recommended limit.

faqs.q: Are there calories in different types of salt?
faqs.a: No, all pure salts (table, sea, Himalayan) have 0 calories regardless of type.
